verses.kjv: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and they besieged it.
verses.ct: In the 9th year of King Zedekiah of Judah, during the 10th month, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army and laid siege to it.

verses.kjv: And in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, the city was broken up.
verses.ct: In Zedekiah's 11th year, on the 9th day of the 4th month, the city walls were breached.

verses.kjv: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, even Nergalsharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, with all the residue of the princes of the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: All the officials of the king of Babylon entered and took their seats at the Middle Gate: Nergalsharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim the Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer the Rabmag, along with the rest of the Babylonian king's officials.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when Zedekiah the king of Judah saw them, and all the men of war, then they fled, and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the king’s garden, by the gate betwixt the two walls: and he went out the way of the plain.
verses.ct: When King Zedekiah of Judah and all his soldiers saw them, they fled. They escaped from the city at night through the king's garden, going out the gate between the two walls, and headed toward the Jordan Valley.

verses.kjv: But the Chaldeans’ army pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he gave judgment upon him.
verses.ct: But the Babylonian army chased after them and caught Zedekiah on the plains of Jericho. They captured him and brought him to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where Nebuchadnezzar passed sentence on him.

verses.kjv: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes: also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.
verses.ct: There at Riblah, the king of Babylon killed Zedekiah's sons right in front of him. He also killed all the nobles of Judah.

verses.kjv: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon.
verses.ct: Then he gouged out Zedekiah's eyes, put him in bronze chains, and had him taken to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house, and the houses of the people, with fire, and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The Babylonians burned down the royal palace and the houses of the people, and they tore down the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to him, with the rest of the people that remained.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, then deported to Babylon the rest of the people who remained in the city, along with those who had deserted to the Babylonians, and the rest of the population.

verses.kjv: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, which had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
verses.ct: However, Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard left behind in the land of Judah some of the poorest people who owned nothing, and at that time he gave them vineyards and fields.

verses.kjv: Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying,
verses.ct: Now King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had given orders about Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard, saying,

verses.kjv: Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
verses.ct: "Find him and take good care of him. Don't harm him in any way. Instead, do whatever he asks you to do."

verses.kjv: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushasban, Rabsaris, and Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, and all the king of Babylon’s princes;
verses.ct: So Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard, along with Nebushasban the Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer the Rabmag, and all the other officials of the king of Babylon, sent for Jeremiah.

verses.kjv: Even they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the prison, and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, that he should carry him home: so he dwelt among the people.
verses.ct: They had Jeremiah brought out of the courtyard of the guard and placed him in the care of Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, to take him home. So Jeremiah lived among the people.

verses.kjv: Now the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
verses.ct: While Jeremiah was still confined in the courtyard of the guard, the LORD's message came to him:

verses.kjv: Go and speak to Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished in that day before thee.
verses.ct: "Go tell Ebedmelech the Ethiopian: This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says — Pay attention: I am about to carry out my words against this city, bringing disaster and not prosperity. It will all happen right before your eyes on that day.

verses.kjv: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith the LORD: and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.
verses.ct: But I will rescue you on that day, declares the LORD. You will not be handed over to the people you are afraid of.

verses.kjv: For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee: because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I will certainly save you, and you will not die by the sword. Your life will be spared as your reward, because you put your trust in me, declares the LORD."
